paragraphs.1: Stresses that it is in the interest of the very survival of humanity that nuclear weapons never be used again, under any circumstances;
paragraphs.2: Emphasizes that the only way to guarantee that nuclear weapons will never be used again is their total elimination;
paragraphs.3: Stresses that the catastrophic effects of a nuclear weapon detonation, whether by accident, miscalculation or design, cannot be adequately addressed;
paragraphs.4: Expresses its firm belief that awareness of the catastrophic consequences of nuclear weapons must underpin all approaches and efforts towards nuclear disarmament;
paragraphs.5: Calls upon all States, in their shared responsibility, to prevent the use of nuclear weapons, to prevent their vertical and horizontal proliferation and to achieve nuclear disarmament;
paragraphs.6: Urges States to exert all efforts to totally eliminate the threat of these weapons of mass destruction;
paragraphs.7: Decides to include in the provisional agenda of its seventy-seventh session, under the item entitled “General and complete disarmament”, the sub-item entitled “Humanitarian consequences of nuclear weapons”.
